interpretation.modesSubtitle: Choose the mode that best suits your needs

simultaneous.name: Simultaneous Interpreting
simultaneous.description: Ideal for meetings and conferences with large audiences. Requires technical equipment, such as interpretation booths with their corresponding consoles, microphones and headsets, and sound systems, as well as headphones for the audience.

consecutive.name: Consecutive Interpreting
consecutive.description: No booths or infrastructure are required in this mode. The interpreter takes notes during the speech and then transmits the message to the audience in the target language.
cons: Slower communication compared to simultaneous interpretation

liaison.name: Liaison or Bilateral Interpreting
liaison.description: The interpreter facilitates communication between two active parties, working in both directions. Unlike other modes, this requires exceptional spoken proficiency in both languages.

remote.name: Remote Simultaneous Interpreting
remote.description: This mode has gained popularity since the COVID-19 pandemic, which required many meetings to be held remotely. It involves interpreting—usually simultaneous—conducted via video conferencing platforms.
pros: No need to travel or invest in infrastructure
cons: Possible technical or connection problems, less reliable

clients.title: Our Clients & Projects
clients.subtitle: This section showcases a list of clients with whom Brucart Translations has worked on significant projects. It details the type of work performed for each client, providing context on how our services have helped fulfill their specific objectives and needs. Projects include both translation and interpretation assignments.
clients.clickToLearnMore: Click on any logo to learn more about our collaboration

who.name: World Health Organization
who.description: We interpreted at webinars about monkeypox organized by the World Health Organization (WHO). Our interpretation contributed to effective communication at global health events, ensuring accuracy and clarity in the transmission of critical information.

gsk.name: GSK
gsk.description: We provided interpreting services for GSK online events aimed at promoting patient advocacy and raising awareness about rare diseases. The main challenge in this project was accurately conveying the speakers’ emotions as they shared their difficult experiences living with conditions such as meningitis.

ffpp.name: World Forum of Fisher Peoples
ffpp.project: Interpreting at the World Forum of Fisher Peoples 2019
ffpp.description: We participated as interpreters in the 2019 World Forum of Fisher Peoples in Sri Lanka. Our interpreting services facilitated dialogue among international delegates, promoting global cooperation and knowledge exchange between fishing communities worldwide.

mapfre.name: Mapfre
mapfre.project: Interpretation at Corporate and Financial Events
mapfre.description: We provided remote simultaneous interpreting services for Mapfre’s internal audit seminars. As one of the leading insurance and reinsurance companies in Spain and Europe, Mapfre’s internal audit seminars involved highly technical discussions that required precise and accurate interpreting. Our thorough preparation enabled us to navigate the complexity of financial and audit terminology with confidence.

forvia.name: Forvia
forvia.description: We provided simultaneous interpreting for internal meetings between Forvia staff in Spain and France, supporting bilateral communication in a multinational corporate environment. Our work facilitated effective coordination between teams from different countries, contributing to the success of the internal meetings.

embratur.name: Embratur - Brazil Tourist Board
embratur.project: Interpreting for the Brazil Pavilion at Fitur Madrid 2024
embratur.description: We provided consecutive interpreting at various cultural events organized at the Brazil Pavilion during the Fitur Madrid 2024 international fair, including masterclasses on caipirinha and Brazilian cuisine. Our work helped promote Brazil’s presence at this major international event, facilitating interaction with visitors and representatives from around the world.

unicaja.name: Banco Unicaja
unicaja.description: Unicaja, one of the leading banks in Spain, aimed to embrace the linguistic diversity of its clientele, ensuring that Catalan-speaking customers felt valued and understood. We undertook the full translation of their website into Catalan, delivering financial content that was both accurate and culturally appropriate. This project was key to improving accessibility and fostering stronger connections with their clients in Catalonia.

structuralia.name: Structuralia
structuralia.description: We provided comprehensive translation and voice-over services for Structuralia, a leading online university in Spain specializing in construction, engineering, and architecture courses. Our work included translating the written course materials into English, as well as translating and recording English voice-overs for the lesson videos delivered by the instructors. Our services played a key role in Structuralia’s expansion into international markets.

tradumedia.name: Tradumedia
tradumedia.description: We established a strategic and long-term partnership with Tradumedia, a rapidly growing translation and interpreting service provider. We collaborated on specialized translation projects as well as liaison interpreting services for their diverse client portfolio.

claire.name: Claire's
claire.description: We provided translation services for Claire's commercial and marketing content for their stores in Catalonia. Our work helped Claire's connect more effectively with their customers in the region.

dbarcelona.name: Diputació de Barcelona
dbarcelona.description: We provided translation services for the Diputació de Barcelona, specifically for digital content aimed at promoting sports and city activities.
